channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Border Patrol has a history of excessive force. Critics say they're out of their depth
item.description: People who study the Border Patrol say it continues to be less well prepared than big city police for handling crowds and situations involving protesters, some of whom are legally armed.
item.content:encoded: People who study the Border Patrol say it continues to be less well prepared than big city police for handling crowds and situations involving protesters, some of whom are legally armed.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: A year after the DCA midair collision, families of those killed push for changes
item.description: Nearly a year after the midair collision over the Potomac River, family members of the victims are still pushing for tougher restrictions in the congested airspace around the nation's capital.
item.content:encoded: Nearly a year after the midair collision over the Potomac River, family members of the victims are still pushing for tougher restrictions in the congested airspace around the nation's capital.
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: U.S. sled racer Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied sixth Olympic bid
item.description: Five-time U.S. Olympian Katie Uhlaender says a point-manipulation scheme blocked her bid to compete in Milan Cortina. U.S. sports officials are backing her bid for a special berth at the Winter Games.
item.content:encoded:
Five-time U.S. Olympian Katie Uhlaender says a point-manipulation scheme blocked her bid to compete in Milan Cortina. U.S. sports officials are backing her bid for a special berth at the Winter Games.

(Image credit: Al Bello)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Amid lawsuits and protests, Trump signals changes to Minnesota immigration surge
item.description: A federal judge on Monday considered the legality of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis, where backlash has intensified after federal agents shot and killed two U.S. citizens this month.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge on Monday considered the legality of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in Minneapolis, where backlash has intensified after federal agents shot and killed two U.S. citizens this month.

(Image credit: Adam Gray)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: At the Rubber Tramp Rendezvous, nomads find community in the Arizona desert
item.description: In Quartzsite, Ariz., self-described nomads who live on the road converge on the Rubber Tramp Rendezvous. There, they fix each other's vehicles, swap practical tips and share resources.
item.content:encoded: In Quartzsite, Ariz., self-described nomads who live on the road converge on the Rubber Tramp Rendezvous. There, they fix each other's vehicles, swap practical tips and share resources.
item.dc:creator: Alina Hartounian

item.title: Hundreds of thousands without power in the U.S. after a powerful winter storm
item.description: A powerful winter storm walloped a huge swath of the U.S., killing at least 25 people. Electricity is out for hundreds of thousands, and freezing rain and snow have coated streets.
item.content:encoded:
A powerful winter storm walloped a huge swath of the U.S., killing at least 25 people. Electricity is out for hundreds of thousands, and freezing rain and snow have coated streets.

(Image credit: Brett Carlsen)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Senators call for Alex Pretti death investigation. And, winter storm recovery efforts
item.description: Minneapolis strikes and protests continue after ICE's fatal shooting of Alex Pretti. And, states work to recover from a massive winter storm that has left widespread power outages and flight chaos.
item.content:encoded:
Minneapolis strikes and protests continue after ICE's fatal shooting of Alex Pretti. And, states work to recover from a massive winter storm that has left widespread power outages and flight chaos.

(Image credit: Octavio Jones)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: After second fatal DHS shooting in Minnesota, state officials fight for role in probe
item.description: Minnesota officials are demanding to have a role in the investigation into Alex Pretti's killing by federal agents as videos and eyewitnesses contradict the Trump administration's account.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota officials are demanding to have a role in the investigation into Alex Pretti's killing by federal agents as videos and eyewitnesses contradict the Trump administration's account.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Minnesota official talks about fatal shooting of man by immigration agent
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Bob Jacobson, the commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Public Safety, about the fatal shooting of 37-year-old intensive care nurse Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Bob Jacobson, the commissioner of the Minnesota Department of Public Safety, about the fatal shooting of 37-year-old intensive care nurse Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Thousands of homes in several states without power after massive winter storm
item.description: The massive winter storm that spread across a wide swath of the country this weekend left hundreds of thousands of homes without power.
item.content:encoded: The massive winter storm that spread across a wide swath of the country this weekend left hundreds of thousands of homes without power.
item.dc:creator: Blake Farmer
